<center>
IUCN status: **Extinct**

Last seen: *Bettongia anhydra were last seen in 1933 in McEwin Hills, Lake Mackay, western Northern Territory*

</center>


### Studies in support

Desert bettongs were last confirmed 48 years after cats arrived (Wallach et al. In Submission).

### Studies not in support

No studies

### Is the threat claim evidence-based?

There are no studies evidencing a link between cats and the extinction of desert bettongs.
<br>
<br>

![**Evidence linking *Bettongia anhydra* to cats.** Last records of extirpated populations relative to earliest local records of cats. Error bars show record uncertainty range. Predator arrival records were digitized from Abbott 2008.](assets/figures/Main_Evidence_Cat_Bettongia anhydra.png)
